entry.title: Replying to @Josh Williams While allergen advisory statements are often used, consumers should be aware that these statements are voluntary and there is no uniform rule that governs what they mean. Thus, a â€œproduced in a facilityâ€ statement is not necess
entry.content: Replying to @Josh Williams While allergen advisory statements are often used, consumers should be aware that these statements are voluntary and there is no uniform rule that governs what they mean. Thus, a â€œproduced in a facilityâ€ statement is not necessarily different from a â€œmay containâ€ statement with regards to whether allergen cross-contact is more likely, or allergen presence is higher and poses greater risk. #greatvalue #foodsafety #foodallergy #foodscience

entry.title: #stitch with @Cheeses3xdeath When a food shows heavy mold growth, "root" threads have invaded it deeply. In dangerous molds, poisonous substances are often contained in and around these threads. In some cases, toxins may have spread throughout the food. M
entry.content: #stitch with @Cheeses3xdeath When a food shows heavy mold growth, "root" threads have invaded it deeply. In dangerous molds, poisonous substances are often contained in and around these threads. In some cases, toxins may have spread throughout the food. More info here: https://www.fsis.usda.gov/food-safety/safe-food-handling-and-preparation/food-safety-basics/molds-food-are-they-dangerous #cheese #moldycheese #foodsafety #foodscience

entry.title: Replying to @J G high moisture, soft, porous foods can be contaminated below the surface, and may have harmful bacteria growing along with the mold, so best to discard if any part has mold. Mold on lower moisture, firm fruits and veggies, hard cheeses,
entry.content: Replying to @J G high moisture, soft, porous foods can be contaminated below the surface, and may have harmful bacteria growing along with the mold, so best to discard if any part has mold. Mold on lower moisture, firm fruits and veggies, hard cheeses, hard salami and dry cured country hams can be cut at least 1 inch around and below the mold spot. Be sure not to touch the knife to the mold. #foodsafety #moldyfood #microbiology #foodscience #greenscreen
